parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A tomb, sepulcher, monument. From mneme; a remembrance, i.e. Cenotaph.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
A young man, youth, an attendant. From the same as neanias; a youth.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From peri and ballo; to throw all around, i.e. Invest.
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.
A long robe, worn by the upper classes in the East. From stello; equipment, i.e., a 'stole' or long-fitting gown.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: To sit, be seated, enthroned; I dwell, reside. From kata; and hemai; to sit down; figuratively, to remain, reside.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
On the right hand, right hand, right. From dechomai; the right side or hand.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To be greatly astonished, be awe-struck. From ekthambos; to astonish utterly.
